searchDocs.title: MDX Blog Post
searchDocs.content: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. ÌåÅ Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. For example, use JSX to create an interactive button: <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

searchDocs.title: How to Add an Application to SAM
1. Open SAM Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Navigate to the Upper Menu.Click the "All Settings" button.

searchDocs.title: 2. Access SAM Configuration‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Find the "Product Specific Settings" section.Click the "SAM Settings" button.

searchDocs.title: 3. Manage Application Monitors‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "Manage Application Monitors".

searchDocs.title: 4. Create a New Application Monitor‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "Application Monitor Templates".Click "Create New Template".

searchDocs.title: 5. Configure Application Monitor‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Set each application monitor setting.

searchDocs.title: 6. Add Component Monitors‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "Add Component Monitors".Select a Component, then click "Add".

searchDocs.title: 7. Finalize Component Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Configure Component settings.Click "Submit" to save changes.

searchDocs.title: Adding an Application to SAM (Windows)‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM

searchDocs.title: 1. Navigate to Windows Management‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Go to Top Menu.Click "Manage Nodes".

searchDocs.title: 2. Select Windows Equipment‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click the Windows category.Select the Windows equipment.

searchDocs.title: 3. Open Real-Time Process Explorer‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "Real-Time Process Explorer".

searchDocs.title: 4. Start Monitoring‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "Start Monitoring".To monitor multiple devices, select checkboxes and click "Start Monitoring".

searchDocs.title: 5. Proceed to Next Step‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click the "Next" button.

searchDocs.title: 6. Choose Monitor Type‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "New Application Monitor", then enter a name.Or select "Existing Application Monitor".Click "Next".

searchDocs.title: 7. Finalize Application Addition‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "OK, Create".

searchDocs.title: Adding an Application to SAM (Linux)‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM

searchDocs.title: 1. Open SAM Settings for Linux‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Navigate to the Upper Menu.Click "All Settings".

searchDocs.title: 2. Access SAM Configuration‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Find "Product Specific Settings".Click "SAM Settings".

searchDocs.title: 3. Manage Application Monitors‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "Manage Application Monitors".

searchDocs.title: 4. Select an Application Monitor Template‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click "Application Monitor Templates".Use the filter ‚Äò0‚Äô.

searchDocs.title: 5. Copy a Template‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click a Template.Click the "Copy" button.

searchDocs.title: 6. Edit the Copied Template‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Click the Copied Template.Click the "Edit" button.

searchDocs.title: 7. Configure Template Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Check each setting.

searchDocs.title: 8. Modify the Script‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Verify Command Line.Click "Edit Script" to modify its function.

searchDocs.title: 9. Test and Save Script Changes‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add an Application to SAM
searchDocs.content: Modify scripts for custom automation, e.g., reboot on process failure.Click "Get Script Output" to validate the result (Error occurs if settings are incorrect).Click "Save", then "Submit" to finalize changes.

searchDocs.title: Each Individual Partition Polling Interval Setup
searchDocs.content: Each Individual Partition Polling Interval Setup 1. Navigate to Partition Management‚Äã Navigate to the Top MenuClick the "Manage Nodes" button 2. Select Partition for Polling Interval Change‚Äã Check the checkbox for the partition you want to modifyClick the "Edit Properties" button 3. Configure Partition Polling Intervals‚Äã Volume Status Polling: Minimum value is 10 secondsVolume Statistics Polling: Minimum value is 1 minute‚úÖ Click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the settings page

searchDocs.title: How to Add a Database to DPA
1. Open DPA Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Navigate to the Upper Menu.Click the "All Settings" button.

searchDocs.title: 2. Access Database Performance Analyzer‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Find the "Product Specific Settings" section.Click the "Database Performance Analyzer" button.

searchDocs.title: 3. Open License Allocation‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Click the "License Allocation" button.Log in, then click "Home".

searchDocs.title: 4. Register a Database Instance‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Click "Register DB Instance for Monitoring".

searchDocs.title: 5. Select Database Type‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Click the "Oracle" radio button.Select "DPA will create/configure the monitoring user" radio button.Click "Next".

searchDocs.title: 6. Configure Connection Details‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Select "Direct Connect" radio button.Enter the Database System SID, IP Address, and Port Number.Default DBA username is system. Enter the DBA password.Click "Next".

searchDocs.title: 7. Proceed to the Next Step‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Click "Next".

searchDocs.title: 8. Create a Monitoring User‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Select "Create Monitoring User? Yes (Recommended)" radio button.Click "Next".

searchDocs.title: 9. Configure Oracle E-Business Suite Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: If Oracle E-Business Suite is installed, select "Yes". Otherwise, select "No".Enter the SYS user password.Click "Next".

searchDocs.title: 10. Confirm Default Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Keep the default values.Click "Next".

searchDocs.title: 11. Set Display Name and Register‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: To change the Display Name, enter a new one.Click "Register Database Instance".

searchDocs.title: 12. Finalize Registration‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add a Database to DPA
searchDocs.content: Wait a few minutes for the registration process to complete.To register another database, click "Register Another Database Instance".Click the "Final" button to complete the setup.

searchDocs.title: üåê Accessing SolarWinds Qcells NMS‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Getting Started
searchDocs.content: The SolarWinds Network Management System (NMS) for Qcells can be accessed via the following URL:  üîó SolarWinds Qcells NMS  This system allows you to:  Monitor and manage network infrastructure.View performance metrics and real-time alerts.Troubleshoot network issues with in-depth diagnostics.

searchDocs.title: üîπ Accessing SolarWinds Qcells DPA‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Getting Started
searchDocs.content: The Database Performance Analyzer (DPA) can be accessed via the following URL:  üîó SolarWinds Qcells DPA  Features of DPA:  Analyze and optimize database performance.Monitor slow queries and system load.Improve overall database efficiency.

searchDocs.title: üõ† Next Steps‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Getting Started
searchDocs.content: To get started with SolarWinds Qcells systems:  Ensure you have the appropriate access credentials.Log in using the provided URLs.Refer to the documentation for detailed monitoring and troubleshooting steps.  üîó Related Docs:

searchDocs.title: How to Register Equipment
searchDocs.content: How to Register Equipment 1. Navigate to Node Management git pu‚Äã Navigate to the Top MenuClick the "Manage Nodes" button 2. Add a New Node‚Äã Click the "Add Node" button 3. Configure Polling Settings‚Äã Insert Polling Hostname or IP AddressCheck Polling MethodClick "Next" 4. Select Application‚Äã Select the Application to be monitored 5. Set Templates and Test‚Äã Set monitoring templatesTest the configuration and click "Next" 6. Review and Configure Custom Properties‚Äã Check each configuration settingEnsure Custom Properties are set correctly 7. Finalize Registration‚Äã Set and check each categoryClick "OK, ADD NODE" to complete the registration

searchDocs.title: Individual Node Polling Interval Setup
searchDocs.content: Individual Node Polling Interval Setup 1. Navigate to Node Management‚Äã Navigate to the Top MenuClick the "Manage Nodes" button 2. Select Node for Polling Interval Change‚Äã Check the checkbox for the node you want to modifyClick the "Edit Properties" button RUN 3. Configure Node Polling Intervals‚Äã Node Status Polling: Minimum value is 10 secondsNode Statistics Polling: Minimum value is 1 minute‚úÖ Click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the settings page

searchDocs.title: How to Add, Delete, and Edit an Account
How to Delete an Account‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add, Delete, and Edit an Account
searchDocs.content: Click on the account you want to delete.Click the "Delete" button to remove the account.

searchDocs.title: How to Edit an Account‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: How to Add, Delete, and Edit an Account
searchDocs.content: a. Access Account Editing‚Äã    Click on the account you want to edit.Click the "Edit" button.  b. Modify Account Settings‚Äã    Edit the necessary settings.Click "Submit" to save the changes.

searchDocs.title: Individual Interface Polling Interval Setup
searchDocs.content: Individual Interface Polling Interval Setup 1. Navigate to Interface Management‚Äã Navigate to the Top MenuClick the "Manage Nodes" button 2. Select Interface for Polling Interval Change‚Äã Check the checkbox for the interface you want to modifyClick the "Edit Properties" button 3. Configure Interface Polling Intervals‚Äã Interface Status Polling: Minimum value is 10 secondsInterface Statistics Polling: Minimum value is 1 minute‚úÖ Click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the settings page

searchDocs.title: How to Edit a Map
searchDocs.content: How to Edit a Map 1. Open the Maps Interface‚Äã Click the "Maps" button from the main menu. 2. Select the Map to Edit‚Äã Click on the name of the map you want to modify. 3. Enter Edit Mode‚Äã Click the "Edit" button to enable editing features. 4. Add or Modify Equipment‚Äã Drag equipment from the left panel to the map.Edit selected equipment in the right panel. 5. Utilize Editing Tools‚Äã Use the editing tools located at the top of the map.Adjust positions, labels, and other elements as needed. 6. Save Changes‚Äã Click the "Save" button to confirm and apply edits.

searchDocs.title: Status Polling Interval Settings
searchDocs.content: Status Polling Interval Settings 1. Navigate to Polling Settings‚Äã Navigate to the Upper MenuClick the "All Settings" button 2. Locate the Polling Settings‚Äã Find the "Polling Settings" button in the middle sectionClick the "Polling Settings" button 3. Default Poll Intervals‚Äã Default Node Poll Interval: Minimum value is 10 secondsDefault Interface Poll Interval: Minimum value is 10 secondsDefault Volume Poll Interval: Minimum value is 10 secondsDefault Rediscover Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Asset Inventory Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 day‚úÖ Click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the settings page 4. Default Statistics & Topology Poll Intervals‚Äã Default Node Topology Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Node Statistics Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Interface Statistics Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minuteDefault Volume Statistics Poll Interval: Minimum value is 1 minute‚úÖ Click the "Submit" button at the bottom of the settings page

searchDocs.title: Copying and Running the Installation Script‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Linux Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: Choose Install via Package Management Tool and click the Next button.Click the item highlighted in the red box and then click the first Copy button (for number 1.).Return to the shell and run the command vi install.sh.Paste the copied code, then type :wq to save it and return to the shell.Run the command chmod 755 install.sh to give execution permission.

searchDocs.title: Running the Installation Script‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Linux Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: 10. Run the command sudo ./install.sh to execute the script. 11. Ensure that you have sudo command authority. 12. Once the script execution is complete, enter the following command: sudo yum clean all && sudo yum -y install swiagent

searchDocs.title: Configuring the Agent‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Linux Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: Confirm that the swiagent installation is complete.In the shell, enter the following command: sudo service swiagentd initSelect 2 and enter 10.204.42.7.Select 5 and enter the given password.Select 7 to save the information.Select yes and press Enter.The information is saved, and you return to the shell.

searchDocs.title: Verifying Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Linux Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: 20. To check if the installation is normal, enter the following command: ps -ef | grep swi 21. If the results appear, the installation is successful. 22. The agent runs automatically and will restart even after a system reboot.

searchDocs.title: Confirming in the Web Interface‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Linux Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: 23. Access http://10.204.42.7/Orion/AgentManagement/Admin/ManageAgents.aspx. 24. Enter the Credentials obtained 25. If you see a new entry in the list as shown on the screen, the installation is successful.

searchDocs.title: Adding a User to the Wheel Group‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Preparations
searchDocs.content: To add a user to the wheel group, use the following command:  usermod -aG wheel <user id> usermod -aG wheel aylimgr usermod -aG wheel dcuomgr     This command appends the specified user (<user id>) to the wheel group, granting them administrative privileges.

searchDocs.title: System Description
searchDocs.content: System Description NPM (Network Performance Monitor)‚Äã SolarWinds Network Performance Monitor (NPM) is a powerful network monitoring solution designed to provide comprehensive visibility and performance insights for IT professionals managing complex network environments. NPM helps organizations: Optimize network performanceIdentify and troubleshoot issues quicklyEnsure the availability and reliability of critical network resources SAM (Server and Application Monitor)‚Äã SolarWinds Server & Application Monitor (SAM) is a comprehensive monitoring solution that provides deep visibility into the performance and health of critical IT infrastructure. SAM helps organizations: Monitor and manage servers, applications, and databasesSupport on-premises, hybrid, and cloud environmentsEnsure optimal application performance and uptime SolarWinds Database Performance Analyzer (DPA)‚Äã SolarWinds Database Performance Analyzer (DPA) is a powerful database performance monitoring and optimization tool that helps identify and resolve database performance issues quickly. Key features include: Real-time performance insightsAnomaly detection and expert recommendationsSupport for popular databases like SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, and more SolarWinds Log Analyzer (LA)‚Äã SolarWinds Log Analyzer (LA) is a centralized log management and analysis solution that enables IT teams to collect, store, and analyze log data from various sources across the infrastructure. LA helps organizations: Troubleshoot issues efficientlyDetect security threats proactivelyEnsure compliance with regulatory requirements SolarWinds Engineer's Toolset‚Äã SolarWinds Engineer's Toolset is a collection of network management tools designed to simplify network administration tasks. The toolset includes: Network discovery and configuration management toolsIP address management utilitiesComprehensive diagnostics for troubleshooting network issues This toolset helps network engineers and administrators streamline daily tasks and efficiently manage network infrastructure.

searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Here are a few tips you might find useful. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

searchDocs.title: Step 1: Open the Web Browser‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Windows Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: Go to SolarWinds Agent Download Page.When the login window appears, log in with the given credential.Click the Login button.

searchDocs.title: Step 2: Download and Install the Agent‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Windows Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: Select the Windows button and click the Next button.Choose Manually Install by Downloading Files via URL and click the Next button.Click the DOWNLOAD.MSI button, then click the Done button.Locate and open the SolarWinds-Agent.msi file.Click Next to begin the installation.Check the box to accept the License Agreement and click Next.Use the default installation path, then click Next.Click the Install button.When prompted, click Yes to confirm the installation.

searchDocs.title: Step 3: Configure the Agent‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Windows Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: Enter the following details when prompted: NMS Server IP Address: 10.204.42.7Orion Server Port: 17778Orion Username/ Password Obtain from the Admin. Click Yes to proceed with the installation.Once the installation is complete, click OK.

searchDocs.title: Step 4: Verify the Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: Windows Agent Installation
searchDocs.content: Access the Agent Management page: http://10.204.42.7/Orion/AgentManagement/Admin/ManageAgents.aspx.Enter the Credentials obtainedIf you see the newly installed agent in the list, the installation was successful.
